contents:
Per Curiam,
After the r,e-reargument of this appeal, ordered upon the application of the appellee* we are still quite clear that the learned court below erred in substituting its discretion for that of' the register, which had not been improperly exercised. Our decree of January. 8, 1917, (McMurray’s Est., 256 Pa. 233), will, therefore, not be disturbed.
